citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The facility had a semiannual animal facility inspection on 22 March 2023, and then had a delayed interval of
approximately 9 months before the next inspection on 12 December 2023. No semiannual animal facility inspections have
been conducted since the last inspection on 12 December 2023 at time of the USDA inspection, a delayed interval of
approximately 8 months. During inspection, a facility representative stated there is a planned semiannual animal facility
inspection for the next day. Failure to conduct semiannual inspections of the animal facilities at least once every 6 months
may hinder the ability of institutional officials to identify problems and take needed corrective actions which may
negatively impact animal welfare.
The IACUC shall inspect, at least once every 6 months, all of the research facility's animal facilities, including animal study
areas, using title 9, chapter I, subchapter A-Animal Welfare, as a basis for evaluation.
Correct by 28 August 2024.

Required information on the acquisition records of dogs is incomplete. The USDA animal number, vehicle license number
and driver's license number are missing on the dog acquisition records for animals acquired from a non-USDA licensed
and non-government entity on 5 February 2024. Failure to fully disclose information of the recordkeeping requirements
may hinder animal traceback activities required during disease outbreak investigation or to ensure compliance with the
Animal Welfare Act regulations.
Per this Section, every research facility shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose
the following information concerning each live dog or cat purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in
their possession or under their control: the name and address of the person from whom the dog or cat was purchased or
otherwise acquired; the vehicle license number and State, and the driver’s license number and State of the person, if he
or she is not licensed or registered under the Act; the date of acquisition; the official USDA identification number
assigned; and a description of each dog or cat.
Correct by 21 September 2024.

The addresses of the persons to whom live dogs were transferred on 16 March 2024 are missing from the dog disposition
records. Accurate disposition records are critical to enable the IACUC and/or USDA to track the movement of research
animals. Every research facility transporting, selling or otherwise disposing of any live dog or cat to another person, shall
make and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose information required in this section 9 CFR 2.35(c)
subsections 1 through 3, to include the name and address of the person the animal was transferred to and the date and
method of transportation.
Correct by 21 September 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.31(c)(2) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The facility had a semiannual animal facility inspection on 22 March 2023, and then had a delayed interval of 
approximately 9 months before the next inspection on 12 December 2023. No semiannual animal facility inspections have 
been conducted since the last inspection on 12 December 2023 at time of the USDA inspection, a delayed interval of 
approximately 8 months. During inspection, a facility representative stated there is a planned semiannual animal facility 
inspection for the next day. Failure to conduct semiannual inspections of the animal facilities at least once every 6 months 
may hinder the ability of institutional officials to identify problems and take needed corrective actions which may 
negatively impact animal welfare. 
 
The IACUC shall inspect, at least once every 6 months, all of the research facility's animal facilities, including animal study 
areas, using title 9, chapter I, subchapter A-Animal Welfare, as a basis for evaluation. 
 
Correct by 28 August 2024. 
2.35(b) 
   
Recordkeeping requirements. 
Required information on the acquisition records of dogs is incomplete. The USDA animal number, vehicle license number 
and driver's license number are missing on the dog acquisition records for animals acquired from a non-USDA licensed 
and non-government entity on 5 February 2024. Failure to fully disclose information of the recordkeeping requirements 
may hinder animal traceback activities required during disease outbreak investigation or to ensure compliance with the 
Animal Welfare Act regulations. 
 
Per this Section, every research facility shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose 
the following information concerning each live dog or cat purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in 
their possession or under their control: the name and address of the person from whom the dog or cat was purchased or 
otherwise acquired; the vehicle license number and State, and the driver’s license number and State of the person, if he 
or she is not licensed or registered under the Act; the date of acquisition; the official USDA identification number 
assigned; and a description of each dog or cat.

Correct by 21 September 2024. 
2.35(c) 
   
Recordkeeping requirements. 
The addresses of the persons to whom live dogs were transferred on 16 March 2024 are missing from the dog disposition 
records. Accurate disposition records are critical to enable the IACUC and/or USDA to track the movement of research 
animals. Every research facility transporting, selling or otherwise disposing of any live dog or cat to another person, shall 
make and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose information required in this section 9 CFR 2.35(c) 
subsections 1 through 3, to include the name and address of the person the animal was transferred to and the date and 
method of transportation. 
 
Correct by 21 September 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
